data.name: CannotAddUser.Text

data.name: CannotChangePassword.Text
data.value: Your configuration requires the user to enter a Question and Answer for the Password reminder. When this setting is applied Administrators are unable to change a user's password, so the feature has been disabled for this site.

data.name: IsOnLine.Help

data.name: LastActivityDate.Help

data.name: LastLockoutDate.Help

data.name: LastLoginDate.Help

data.name: LastPasswordChangeDate.Help
data.value: The date this user last changed their password.

data.name: LockedOut.Help
data.value: Indicates whether the user is currently locked out of the site due to repetitive failed logins.

data.name: OptionUnavailable.Text
data.value: Reset Password option is currently unavailable.

data.name: PasswordInvalid.Text

data.name: PasswordResetFailed.Text
data.value: Your new password was not accepted for security reasons. Please enter a password that you haven't used before and is long and complex enough to meet the site's password complexity requirements.

data.name: PasswordResetFailed_PasswordInHistory.Text
data.value: Your new password was not accepted for security reasons. Please choose a password that hasn't been used before.

data.name: PasswordSent.Text

data.name: UserPasswordUpdateChanged.Text

data.value: You must provide a password confirmation.

data.name: RoleIsNotApproved.Text
data.value: Cannot assign a role which is not approved.

data.name: Prompt_CannotPurgeUser.Text
data.value: Cannot purge user that has not been deleted first. Try delete-user.

data.name: Prompt_DateParseError.Text
data.value: Unable to parse the {0} Date '{1}'. Try using YYYY-MM-DD format.

data.name: Prompt_EmailSent.Text
data.value: An email has been sent to the user.

data.name: Prompt_IfSpecifiedMustHaveValue.Text
data.value: If you specify the --{0} flag, it must be set to True or False.

data.name: Prompt_NothingToSetUser.Text
data.value: Nothing to update. Please pass-in one or more flags with values to update on the user or type 'help set-user' for more help

data.name: Prompt_NoUserId.Text
data.value: No User ID passed. Nothing to do.

data.name: Prompt_OnlyOneFlagRequired.Text
data.value: You must specify one and only one flag: --{0}, --{1}, or --{2}.

data.name: Prompt_RestoreNotRequired.Text
data.value: This user has not been deleted. Nothing to restore.

data.name: Prompt_SearchUserParameterRequired.Text
data.value: To search for a user, you must specify either --id (UserId), --email (User Email), or --name (Username).

data.name: Prompt_StartDateGreaterThanEnd.Text
data.value: Start Date cannot be less than End Date.

data.name: Prompt_UserAlreadyDeleted.Text
data.value: User is already deleted. Want to delete permanently? Use \"purge-user\"

data.name: Prompt_UserDeletionFailed.Text
data.value: The user was found but the system is unable to delete it.

data.name: Prompt_UserIdIsRequired.Text
data.value: You must specify a valid User ID as either the first argument or using the --id flag.

data.name: Prompt_UserPurged.Text
data.value: The User has been permanently removed from the site.

data.name: Prompt_AddRoles_ResultHtml.Text
data.value:
Add a Role to a User

add-roles --id 23 --roles Editor OR add-roles 23 --roles Editor OR add-roles --id 23 "Editor"

Add a Multi-Word Role to a User

add-roles --id 23 --roles "Article Reviewer"

Add Multiple Roles to a User

add-roles --id 23 --roles "Editor, Writer, Article Reviewer"

data.name: Prompt_AddRoles_Description.Text
data.value: Add one or more DNN security roles to a user.

data.name: Prompt_AddRoles_FlagId.Text
data.value: User ID of user to which the roles will be added. If a number is passed as the first argument, you do not need to use the --id flag explicitly

data.name: Prompt_AddRoles_FlagRoles.Text
data.value: Comma-delimited string of DNN role names to apply to user.

data.name: Prompt_AddRoles_NotFound.Text
data.value: Cannot find role{0} '{1}'. --roles parameter only accepts existent roles.

data.name: Prompt_DeleteUser_Description.Text
data.value: Deletes the specified user from the portal. After deletion, the user can still be recovered. To delete the user permanently, follow this command with the purge-user command.

data.name: Prompt_DeleteUser_FlagId.Text
data.value: The user's User ID. If the flag is not used, then the user's ID must be the first argument.

data.name: Prompt_DeleteUser_FlagNotify.Text
data.value: If true, the "Unregister User" notification email will be sent (typically to the site Admin)

data.name: Prompt_DeleteUser_ResultHtml.Text
data.value:
Delete a User

This delete's the user with a User ID of 345. The user is not permanently deleted at this point. It is in a kind of recycle bin. You can use get-user 345 to see the user details and you'll see that the IsDeleted property is now True. So, you can use the restore-user command to recover the user record or you can recover the user using DNN's user interface. If you want to permanently delete the user, then you'll need to execute a second command: purge-user

delete-user 345

This is the more explicit form of the above code.

delete-user --id 345

Delete a User and Send Notification

This delete's the user with a User ID of 345 and sends an email notification. Like above, the user is not permanently deleted at this point. If you want to permanently delete the user, then you'll need to execute a second command: purge-user

delete-user 345 --notify true

This is the more explicit form of the above code.

delete-user --id 345 --notify true

data.name: Prompt_GetUser_FlagEmail.Text
data.value: The email address for the user being retrieved. You can use the asterisk ( * ) as a wildcard to signify 0 or more characters.

data.name: Prompt_GetUser_FlagId.Text
data.value: Explicitly specifies the UserId for the user being retrieved.

data.name: Prompt_GetUser_FlagUsername.Text
data.value: The username for the user being retrieved. You can use the asterisk ( * ) as a wildcard to signify 0 or more characters.

data.name: Prompt_GetUser_ResultHtml.Text
data.value:
Get Current User

get-user

Get User by User ID

Implicit Use of --id flag

When specifying a single value after the command name, if it is an integer, Prompt will assume it is a User ID

get-user 345
Explicit use of --id flag

You can explicitly use the --id flag to avoid any confusion

get-user --id 345
UserId : 345
Username : jsmith
Email : jsmith@sample.com
DisplayName : John Smith
FirstName : John
LastName : Smith
LastLogin : 2016-12-06T09:31:38.413-07:00
IsAuthorized : true

Get User by Email

Implicit Use of --email flag

When specifying a single value after the command name, if it contains the at symbol ( @ ), Prompt will assume it is an Email

get-user jsmith@sample.com
Explicit Use of --email flag

You can explicitly use the --email flag to avoid any confusion

get-user --email jsmith@sample.com
UserId : 345
Username : jsmith
Email : jsmith@sample.com
DisplayName : John Smith
FirstName : John
LastName : Smith
LastLogin : 2016-12-06T09:31:38.413-07:00
IsAuthorized : true

Search for User by Email Using Wildcards

Implicit Use of --email flag

When specifying a single value after the command name, if it contains the at symbol ( @ ), Prompt will assume it is an Email. Only the first matched user record will be returned. Try using list-users if you would like to find all matching users.

get-user jsmith*@sample.com
Explicit Use of --email flag
get-user --email jsmith*@sample.com
UserId : 345
Username : jsmith
Email : jsmith@sample.com
DisplayName : John Smith
FirstName : John
LastName : Smith
LastLogin : 2016-12-06T09:31:38.413-07:00
IsAuthorized : true

Get User by Username

Implicit Use of --username flag

When specifying a single value after the command name, if it is not a number and does not contain the at symbol ( @ ), Prompt will assume it is a Username

get-user jsmith
Explicit Use of --username flag

You can explicitly use the --username flag to avoid any confusion

get-user --username jsmith
UserId : 345
Username : jsmith
Email : jsmith@sample.com
DisplayName : John Smith
FirstName : John
LastName : Smith
LastLogin : 2016-12-06T09:31:38.413-07:00
IsAuthorized : true

Search for User by Username Using Wildcards

Implicit Use of --username flag

When specifying a single value after the command name, if it is not a number and does not contain the at symbol ( @ ), Prompt will assume it is a Username

get-user --username jsmith*
Explicit Use of --username flag
get-user jsmith* (value cannot have an @ symbol or be interpreted as an Integer for this to work)
UserId : 345
Username : jsmith
Email : jsmith@sample.com
DisplayName : John Smith
FirstName : John
LastName : Smith
LastLogin : 2016-12-06T09:31:38.413-07:00
IsAuthorized : true

data.name: Prompt_ListUsers_Description.Text
data.value: Find users based on email or username. Supports partial matching on Email or Username. You can only search by on flag at a time. Flags may not be combined.

data.name: Prompt_ListUsers_FlagEmail.Text
data.value: A search pattern to search for in the user's email address. You can use the asterisk ( * ) as a wildcard to signify 0 or more characters

data.name: Prompt_ListUsers_FlagMax.Text
data.value: Page Size for the page. Max is 500.

data.name: Prompt_ListUsers_FlagRole.Text
data.value: The name of the DNN Security Role whose members you'd like to list. IMPORTANT: wildcard searching is NOT enabled for this flag at this time. Role names are case-insensitive but spacing must match.

data.name: Prompt_ListUsers_FlagUsername.Text
data.value: A search pattern to search for in the username. You can use the asterisk ( * ) as a wildcard to signify 0 or more characters

data.name: Prompt_ListUsers_ResultHtml.Text
data.value:
List All Users in Current Portal

list-users

Search for Users by Email

Implicit Use of --email flag

When specifying a single value after the command name, if it contains the at symbol ( @ ), Prompt will assume it is an Email

list-users jsmith@sample.com
Explicit use of --email flag
list-users --email jsmith@sample.com
UserId:345
Username:jsmith
Email:jsmith@sample.com
DisplayName:John Smith
FirstName:John
LastName:Smith
LastLogin:2016-12-06T09:31:38.413-07:00

Search for Users by Email Using Wildcards

Implicit Use of --email flag

When specifying a single value after the command name, if it contains the at symbol ( @ ), Prompt will assume it is an Email

list-users jsmith*@sample.com
Explicit use of --email flag
list-users --email jsmith*@sample.com
UserId Username Email DisplayName FirstName LastName LastLogin IsAuthorized
345 jsmith jsmith@sample.com John Smith John Smith 2016-12-06T09:31:38.413-07:00 true
1095 jsmithson jsmithson@sample.com Jerry Smithson Jerry Smithson 2016-12-063T08:15:28.123-07:00 true

Search for Users by Username

Implicit Use of --username flag

When specifying a single value after the command name, if it is not a number and does not contain the at symbol ( @ ), Prompt will assume it is a Username

list-users jsmith
Explicit Use of --username flag
list-users --username jsmith
UserId:345
Username:jsmith
Email:jsmith@sample.com
DisplayName:John Smith
FirstName:John
LastName:Smith
LastLogin:2016-12-06T09:31:38.413-07:00
IsAuthorized:true
Created:2016-12-06T09:31:38
IsDeleted:false

Search for User by Username Using Wildcards

Implicit Use of --username flag

When specifying a single value after the command name, if it is not a number and does not contain the at symbol ( @ ), Prompt will assume it is a Username

list-users jsmith*
Explicit Use of --username flag
list-users --username jsmith*
UserId Username Email LastLogin IsDeleted IsAuthorized
345 jsmith jsmith@sample.com 2016-12-06T09:31:38.413-07:00 false true
1095 jsmithson jsmithson@sample.com 2016-12-063T08:15:28.123-07:00 false true

List Users In a DNN Security Role

list-users --role "Registered Users"
UserId Username Email LastLogin IsDeleted IsAuthorized
2 admin admin@mysite.com 2016-12-01T06:03:10-07:00 false true
3 tuser1 tuser1@mysite.com 2016-12-01T09:31:38.413-07:00 false true
31 jsmith jsmith@mysite.com 2016-12-19T12:23:39-07:00 false true

data.name: Prompt_NewUser_Description.Text
data.value: Creates a new User record in the portal

data.name: Prompt_NewUser_FlagApproved.Text
data.value: Whether the user account is authorized. Defaults to true if not specified.

data.name: Prompt_NewUser_FlagNotify.Text
data.value: If true, the system email will be sent to the user at the user's email address. The type of email is determined by the registration type. If this is not passed, the default portal settings will be observed. If the site's registration mode is set to None, no email will be sent regardless of the value of --notify.

data.name: Prompt_NewUser_FlagPassword.Text
data.value: The Password for the user account. If not specified, a random password will be generated. Note that unless you are forcing the user to reset their password, you should ensure that someone is notified of the password.

data.name: Prompt_NewUser_ResultHtml.Text
data.value:
Create a New User with Just the Required Values

This generates a random password and assigns it to the newly created user. Display name is generated by concatenating the first and last name. Note that because "van Doorne" contains a space, we need to enclose it in double-quotes. The resulting Display name will be "Erik van Doorne".

new-user --username edoorne --email edoorne@myemail.com --firstname Erik --lastname "van Doorne"

data.name: Prompt_ResetPassword_Description.Text
data.value: Sets the reset password token for the user. It does not automatically reset the user's password. By default, this command will send the reset password email to the user. You can override this behavior by specifying the --notify flag with a value of false

data.name: Prompt_ResetPassword_FlagId.Text
data.value: User ID of user to send Reset Password link to.

data.name: Prompt_ResetPassword_FlagNotify.Text
data.value: If true, the system email will be sent to the user at the user's email address.

data.name: Prompt_SetUser_Description.Text
data.value: Enables you to set various values related to the specified user.

data.name: Prompt_SetUser_FlagDisplayname.Text
data.value: The name to be displayed for the user.

data.name: Prompt_SetUser_FlagEmail.Text
data.value: The email address to set for the user.

data.name: Prompt_SetUser_FlagFirstname.Text
data.value: The first name of the user.

data.name: Prompt_SetUser_FlagId.Text
data.value: The UserId for the user being updated. This value is required, but if you pass the value as the first argument after the command name, you do not need to explicitly use the --id flag. (see the examples below)

data.name: Prompt_SetUser_FlagLastname.Text
data.value: The last name of the user.

data.name: Prompt_SetUser_FlagPassword.Text
data.value: The new password to assign to the user. The password must be valid according to the site's password rules.

data.name: Prompt_SetUser_FlagUsername.Text
data.value: The username to set for the user.

data.name: Prompt_SetUser_ResultHtml.Text
data.value:
Approve/UnApprove a User

Approves/UnApproves the user with a User ID of 345. In this example, true is passed for the --approve flag.

set-user 345 --approve true

Change a User's Username

Changes the username of the user with a User ID of 345 to john.smith.

set-user 345 --username "john.smith"

Change a User's Name Properties

Sets the first, last, and display name for the user with an ID of 345. Note that John and Smith do not need to be surrounded by quotes but Johnny Smith does since it is more than one word.

set-user 345 --firstname John --lastname Smith --displayname "Johnny Smith"

data.name: Prompt_GetUser_Description.Text
data.value: Enables you to display the current user's information, or retrieve a user by their User ID, Username or Email address. Supports partial searching. Returns the first user found.

data.name: Answer.Help
data.value: Enter an answer to the password question.

data.name: Answer.Required
data.value: You must provide a password answer.

data.name: Question.Help
data.value: Enter a password question to be used when retrieving the password.

data.name: Question.Required
data.value: You must provide a password question.

data.name: HasAgreedToTerms.title
data.value: User has agreed to terms of use

data.name: HasNotAgreedToTerms.title
data.value: User has not agreed to terms of use

data.name: RequestsRemoval.title
data.value: User has requested removal from site

data.name: HasAgreedToTerms.Help
data.value: The user has agreed to the terms of use and privacy statement of this site through the data consent mechanism

data.name: LastConsented.Help
data.value: The last time the user consented to the terms of this site. If the terms have been changed since, the user may be marked as not having consented

data.name: RemoveDeleted.Confirm
data.value: Do you wish to permanently remove deleted users? You cannot undo this operation.

data.name: RemoveDeleted.Done
data.value: All deleted users have been removed
